summary: This document is an Authorization of Power of Attorney for brokerage and retirement accounts with DBSI. It outlines the responsibilities and authority granted to an agent by the principal, including the ability to manage financial transactions on behalf of the principal. The document emphasizes the importance of understanding the implications of granting such authority.
keyFacts: The document serves as a non-durable limited power of attorney for financial accounts.
It requires the principal to understand the authority they are granting to their agent.
The agent cannot make health care decisions for the principal.
The principal can revoke the power of attorney at any time as long as they are of sound mind.
The document includes a cautionary note regarding the responsibilities of the agent.
